head.supplied: 9th Decr. [18]93 ¶ Sir, ¶ ¶ I beg to inform you that pursuant to my inquiry of the 4th instant, as to whether Mr Renner's services could be spared from your branch that gentlemen called on me on the ...

div.p: No.788, p. 386, unit 102, VPRS 1187/P, outward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office of Victoria.

I beg to inform you that pursuant to my inquiry of the 4th instant, as to whether Mr Renner's services could be spared from your branch that gentlemen called on me on the 6th instant and as he appeared to be in a bad state of health I gave him leave of absence until Monday next when he has been directed to report himself to you.
As temporary clerical assistance is required in this office I shall be glad if you will then instruct Mr Renner (if his health permits) to report himself at this office for duty immediately.

p.style: font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-family: Geneva;

div.p: I have the honor to be,
